data.title: 'Kamen Rider' rides into KL with a 50th-anniversary celebration exhibition
data.description: Fans of Japanese tokusatsu ("special effects") and superhero culture are in for a treat as the Kamen Rider 50 Years Exhibition comes to Kuala Lumpur. This immersive showcase will celebrate over five decades of the iconic franchise, highlighting its cultural impact, technological evolution, and lasting appeal.

data.title: 14 southern provinces In Thailand on high alert for floods from Tuesday (Dec 3)
data.description: BANGKOK (Bernama): Fourteen provinces in southern Thailand have been warned to prepare for potential flash floods, runoff, and prolonged flooding between Dec 3 to 5.

data.title: Celebrate year-end at Noble Play
data.description: The "Ploencharit Festival" is back at Noble Play to spread happiness and sustainability for three weeks, starting today. It will run every Tuesday to Friday from 5pm to 11pm, until Dec 20.

data.title: Flamenco fusion
data.description: Flamenco is one of the musical delights of southern Spain. It developed out of folk traditions of the Gitano subculture of Andalusia and features dramatic guitar, singing and dancing, often supported by some kind of percussion, especially handclaps and castanets.

data.title: Thai star Aokbab makes history with Emmy win
data.description: Thai actress Chutimon Chuengcharoensukying, also known as Aokbab, became the first ever Thai actor to win an International Emmy Award. The 28-year-old won an award for Best Performance for her role in Hunger, a Netflix original film that captivated audiences worldwide with its powerful storytelling.

data.title: Maison JE presents a touch of autumn
data.description: A captivating collection of abstract expressionist paintings by a young female Japanese artist are showcased during "Autumn Night" at Maison JE Bangkok, until Dec 22.

data.title: Dine out with dad

data.title: Fine Arts Department announces ‘Night at the Museum’ event
data.description: Night at the Museum runs from 8.30am to 8pm, December 20 to 22

data.title: Phumtham updates on arrest of Thai fishermen by Myanmar military
data.description: He emphasises that the matter must proceed through diplomatic channels

data.title: Myanmar ambassador summoned over detention of Thai nationals
data.description: Maris urges Myanmar to release Thai fishing vessel and four detained Thai crew members without delay

data.title: Paetongtarn eyes national disaster centre to handle floods, droughts
data.description: The aim is to ensure timely assistance is delivered to affected areas and prevention measures put in place where possible, says spokesman

data.title: New drug crackdown results in 4,784 arrests, 44m meth pill haul
data.description: A nationwide operation to ‘clip wings of drug pushers’ also resulted in the seizure of a cache of crystal meth, heroin and firearms, as well as the freezing of assets worth 579 million baht

data.title: PM can manage southern flood relief efforts from afar: Natthaphong
data.description: Opposition leader says PM Paetongtarn doesn’t need to be physically present in all disaster areas, the focus must be on relief efforts instead

data.title: Monk’s DIY eyebrows to unlock welfare card payment go viral
data.description: Store staff fashion makeshift eyebrows from black adhesive tape to help solve the face-scanning problem in the state payment app

data.title: Sarapad Thai Your Gateway to Modern Thainess
data.description: Today, we’re going shopping at One Bangkok, 3rd floor, Parade Zone—a destination where Thailand’s cultural essence meets bold, modern creativity.

data.title: The Office Thonglor | The Nation Lifestyle
data.description: If you're looking for a vibrant community space in the heart of Bangkok, The Office Thonglor is the perfect destination for you. Here, you can hang out and seamlessly balance work and life from morning until night.

data.title: Boonsong is eligible for release on parole: Corrections Dept
data.description: The former commerce minister released on probation because he has served most of his prison term, said department chief

data.title: Thai car market suffering sales slump
data.description: Decline attributed to several issues, including significant slowdown in overall economy

data.title: Floods devastate rubber plantations in South of Thailand
data.description: Up to 20 billion baht of damages expected as rubber farmers will not be able to tap their trees for another six weeks

data.title: Photo exhibit celebrates a special friendship
data.description: Austria and Hungary recently organised a photo exhibition marking the 155th anniversary of their relationship with Thailand. The launch event was co-hosted by the Austrian and Hungarian embassies last week at Queen Sirikit National Convention Center.

data.title: Boonsong freed after 7 years in jail for Yingluck govt rice deal
data.description: Former commerce minister granted compassionate parole to serve out remainder of sentence at home in Chiang Mai

data.title: Finance Ministry seeks another THB50bn for flood relief in South
data.description: Money will fund soft loans and debt relief for thousands of households and businesses across five inundated provinces

data.title: Thais urged to donate blood to mark King Rama IX’s birthday
data.description: Public invited to give blood at donation centres nationwide throughout December in memory of beloved late king

data.title: Thai cross-border trade jumps 6.18%, boosted by fruit to China
data.description: Commerce Ministry announces trade worth 1.514 trillion baht in first 10 months of 2024, sets target of 2 trillion baht per year by 2030

data.title: Credit card debt cuts will only apply to those on credit bureau list
data.description: National Economic and Social Development Council stresses that the proposed measures do not refer to regular credit card accounts

data.title: Hydrogen and nuclear power to drive transition to clean energy
data.description: EGAT, PTT, Bangchak and Mitsubishi Power outline their plans to help Thailand move away from polluting fossil fuels

data.title: Traceability from farm to table
data.description: How technological innovation is changing the world, promoting sustainable practices in the production and supply of food

data.title: Thailand’s famed hot and sour soup to gain UNESCO recognition
data.description: Culture Ministry to celebrate the registration of tom yum kung and kebaya by UNESCO with a three-day event at EmQuartier

data.title: Sunny and cool for most of Thailand, scattered thunderstorms in South
data.description: Rain eases in Southern Thailand but more downpours to come later in the week, Thailand Meteorological Department warns

data.title: Chaowalit Phalaphon, Thai Senior "Sogo" Champion, receives 240,000 baht
data.description: Chaowalit Phalaphon wins Thai Senior Tour, receives 240,000 baht prize money, last course in Phuket Province, Sunday, December 1, 2024
